content: opened version bump: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/92639

ok triaged all regressions, the only issue that remained open is https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/91872, even though it might just be the crater version of https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/90904 (in which case it should be closed)
force-pushed stable
force-pushed beta
@simulacrum https://github.com/rust-lang/simpleinfra/pull/88
@Pietro Albini it looks like rls is broken on linux and windows, not sure if that affects stable yet but probably beta builds will fail
looks like caused by https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/91539, so probably beta promotion will fail

yep got a mail it failed
can't look much into it right now but I have time tomorrow morning
sounds good. it's probably easier to just re-introduce that feature gate on a dummy struct in std fwiw, otherwise it'll be a bit of a pain to fix currently.

Just FYI, rls should be fine for stable.
Does anyone know if xanewok is around? I took a quick peek at the issue a while back, but it looked like it required updating racer and that whole dance.
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/91543
rls is even more broken

   --> src/tools/rls/rls-rustc/src/clippy.rs:62:9

62  |         clippy_lints::register_pre_expansion_lints(&mut lint_store);

417 | pub fn register_pre_expansion_lints(store: &mut rustc_lint::LintStore, sess: &Session, conf: &Conf) {
    |        ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
and whelp I can't reproduce those unused warnings locally
ok reproduced the warnings

#91543 is the culprit. I know what has to be done to fix it and can do this. The question is just, if Racer should move to using rustc-dev or if we want to keep the rustc-ap crates around.

I have a PR open to move Racer to rustc-dev, which would fix RLS: https://github.com/racer-rust/racer/pull/1174
no matter what, someone has to approve/merge a Racer PR to either update the rustc-ap crates (which will require a fix of the rustc-ap repo and restarting of the workflow by Alex) or my rustc-dev PR.

which would fix RLS

With a Racer version bump and another RLS update that is.

The RLS fix for the clippy API change is trivial, I can create a PR. For the feature gate the easiest would probably be to add a dummy feature gate for the beta like:

// FIXME: This is only temporary to make RLS build again. The correct fix is to remove
// the usage of `thread_local_const_init` in rustc-ap or make racer no longer depend on
// rustc-ap.
#[doc(hidden)]
#[unstable(feature = "thread_local_const_init", issue = "91543")]
pub const fn just_to_make_rls_build() {}
I already have https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/92734/commits/19ae40b0f7b8f57cc08e07836194dcba26cd9293 for the feature gate
which is kinda the same but private

Minimal fix for the clippy API change:
https://github.com/rust-lang/rls/pull/1759
kicked off dev stable
given the comment on hans's PR I'll try bumping rls on beta (locally first)

does anyone have an idea of why https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/92887 is failing? couldn't figure it out yet, and I won't have much time this week :(
best guess is an upstream cargo change with rustdoc and cargo check no longer having the same crate hash
I'd check with a manual swap to old cargo, and then try https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/pull/10172 reverted
er, actually, probably https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/pull/9419
although that's too old, 1.53
hm, intuition there may be wrong - maybe a rustdoc/rustc_resolve interaction? I think there was some recent work there. I'd probably recommend -vvv and then bisecting across rustcs
hm, so it looks like a successful compilation re-checks panic_unwind -- maybe we stopped setting some feature flags on std?
I'm taking a look, I have a suspicion what it is.
I believe it is caused by cargo#10201. I'll look at fixing it. It will require pushing an update to beta cargo.

Posted cargo#10324 with a fix.

Sorry about that, it was an obvious oversight.
Thanks!
